intro: Spondias bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia spondias, is a small to medium-sized tree native to Brazil. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes cashew and mango. The tree is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and simple, alternate leaves that are elliptic in shape. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in panicles, and it produces small, round fruits that turn red when mature. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
